CAREER SUMMARY  
 
Feb 2016 to d ate Johnson & Johnson – Middles East, Africa & Turkey  
Position: HR Services Leader – GCC & HR Business Partner ME (Grow 
Assignment)  
 
Feb 2022 - Present - HR Business Partner ME (Grow Assignment):  
• Support the HR Director in developing and driving the HR strategies that are 
aligned with the organization  goals. Co -drive HR priorities with the board 
members.  
• Drive a strong culture through application of organizational development 
interventions, coaching and business partnership.  
• Work collaboratively with People leaders to identify talents and develop t heir 
talent plan to ensure building strong calibers.  
• Develop country talent strategy in partnership with stakeholders to grow diverse 
leadership talent.  
• Ensure implementation of global HR strategy in their area of scope to ensure 
alignment with global priorities. Provide insight into the development of global 
strategy.  
• Partner with leadership to identify business needs and challenges and provide 
appropriate HR solutions that are aligned with business direction, to ensure 
effective talent management and to improve individual and organizational 
performance and engagement . 
• Use all available HR data to ensure HR analytics supports all reporting, action 
planning and decision making and put forward recommendations for change.  
 
Mar 2020 - Present: HR Services Leader - GCC  
    
• Serve as a trusted partner to advise and coach employee s and managers on 
all human resources programs and activities.  
• Work collaboratively with line managers in leading and managing their people 
by providing inductions, training material and performance management 
guidance  
• Partner with COE to ensure coordination of HR strategies and key processes 
across the organization for seamless implementation  
• Handle employee relations issues, assess related legal risk and make 
recommendations to resolve concerns and/or improve morale.  
• Implement effective strategies to enable the organization to thrive through 
periods of change, (e.g. restructurings), while promoting cultural understanding 
and diversity.  
• Ensure compliance with company policies/ procedures, global guidelines and 
employme nt law.  
 
Feb 2016 - Feb 2020  
Position: HR Specialist - UAE, Egypt, Saudi Arabia  
• Responsible for ensuring the implementation of HR policies, and continuously 
improve HR tools, practices and activities, that are compliant with local laws 
and regulations  
• Provide advice and counsel to employees on general workplace policies and 
practices, issues related to their job performance as well as career 
development and job opportunities.  
• Partner and engage with HR group specialists to develop and implement HR 
Initiatives that enable organizational success and maximize employee 
engagement and motivation at all levels.  
• Engage with key stakeholders to review delivery of service, plan resource 
requirements and identify opportunities for improvement  
• Create and implem ent effective onboarding and offboarding plans and conduct 
orientation sessions.  
• Participate in relevant projects, leading and championing as appropriate.  
• Responsible for communication and training of all HR policies and programs to 
employees including  new hires.
